thread.title: DIARY- Emerging Markets Economic Events to Sept 15
thread.title_full: DIARY- Emerging Markets Economic Events to Sept 15 | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: DIARY- Emerging Markets Economic Events to Sept 15
text:
Sept 2 (Reuters) -
For other diaries, please see:
Top economic events
Government debt auctions
Political and general news events
Index of all diaries
Guide to economic indicators
** This Diary is filed daily *** WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 2 JAKARTA - Conference on "Future of Asian financing" in Indonesia. Speakers:- IMF Managing Director Christine Lagarde, Reserve Bank of India Deputy Governor Urjit Patel, Bank of Japan Deputy Governor Hiroshi Nakaso, Indonesia Finance Minister Bambang Brodjonegoro and IMF Monetary and Capital Markets Department Division Chief Ulric Erickson von Allmen. NEW DELHI - Indian junior finance minister Jayant Sinha to speak on "Financing for Development and Post 2015 Agenda: Way Forward from Addis." CEBU, Philippines - Philippines Finance Secretary Cesar Purisima, and Deputy Central Bank Governor Diwa Guinigundo hold separate media briefings ahead of the APEC Finance Ministers' meeting and deputy central bankers meeting. They are expected to talk about a Cebu Action Plan to be adopted at the end of the meeting. JAKARTA - International Monetary Fund Managing Director Christine Lagarde holds press conference - 0915 GMT. YOKOHAMA, Japan - Asian Development Bank President Takehiko Nakao speaks on Asia's economy and the ADB's role - 0100 GMT. WARSAW - National Bank of Poland announces rate decision - 0930 GMT. BRASILIA - Brazilian central bank announces rate decision - 2200 GMT. KUALA LUMPUR - Central bank of Malaysia holds Monetary Policy Committee meeting (to Sept. 3).
THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 3 KUALA LUMPUR - Central bank of Malaysia announces interest rate decision - 1000 GMT. MISKOLC, Hungary - Annual conference of economists with Hungarian central bankers and Economy minister Mihaly Varga (to Sept. 5)
FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 4
TOKYO - International Monetary Fund Deputy Director (Asia and Pacific Department) Kalpana Kochhar speaks at the IMF seminar - Reloading Abenomics: Priorities for the Needed Regime Shift - 0600 GMT. ANKARA - G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors meeting (to Sept. 5).
SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 5 ANAKRA - German Finance Minister Wolfgang Schaeuble and ECB Governing Council member Jens Weidmann holds a press conference at G20 Meeting - 0500 GMT
MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 7 ISTANBUL, Turkey - Young Businessmen Association of Turkey (TUGIAD) hosts Young Entrepreneurs' Alliance (YEA), part of G20 summit (to Sept. 9).
WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 9
BUDAPEST - Central bank of Hungary to publish the minutes of August rate meeting - 1200 GMT.
THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 10 BELGRADE - National bank of Serbia holds Executive Board Meeting to decide on interest rate - 1000 GMT.
FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 11 HARARE - IMF will hold a joint press conference with Zimbabwe Finance Minister Patrick Chinamasa after reviewing Zimbabwe's performance under an ongoing staff monitoring programme, to help it strengthen the country's macro-economic and financial policies and how to clear its debts, which could clear the way for Harare to access much needed international credit in future.
SEOUL - Bank of Korea holds Monetary Policy Committee Meeting - 0100 GMT. MOSCOW - Central bank of Russia announces interest rate decision - 1100 GMT.
TUESDAY, SEPTMEBER 15 BEIRUT - Beirut hosts an Iraqi banking forum (to Sept. 16) at the Phoenicia Hotel attended by the central bank governors of both countries. The forum will discuss Iraqi central bank's policies to improve the financial situation in the country.
